channel.title: Home on wnccys
channel.description: Recent content in Home on wnccys

item.title: Crafting a CLI Tracerouter from Scratch
item.author: wnccys@proton.me (Vinicius de Souza)
item.description: In this tutorial, we’re going to make an CLI Tracerouter which uses a ICMP packet request approach, since the Raw Socket creation until the entire trace itself, what gives us a great vision of how requests are made and sent over the Internet, as well as we crafting our own Checksum function! Don’t get too hung up on these terms right now, the article is made to instruct first-way people who are interested in understanding the Internet deeper as well as the experienced ones.

item.title: About
item.author: wnccys@proton.me (Vinicius de Souza)
item.description:
21yo generalist back-end developer from Brazil interested in decentralization, type-theory, compilers and software architecture.

I started to practice programming at ~14 years old with Ruby when later I joined the Stellantis Young Talents Program, in 2023, where I was resposible for take care of some global data management systems with huge ECS and Fargate integrations; organized/wrote some presentations and articles for other students, until late 2025 where I joined a bachelor’s degree which I’m currently focused on.

item.title: Now
item.author: wnccys@proton.me (Vinicius de Souza)
item.description:
Building: A custom container runtime in Rust.

Learning: Polonius borrow checker and OCI specs. Also practicing Italian daily.

Reading:

  • Grokking Algorithms
  • Fundamentals of Software Architecture: An Engineering Approach
